intro: Verbascum tempskyanum, commonly known as the Tempskyan mullein. This plant is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, gray-green leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
